response.answer_text: Yes dear friend , Destiny does exists . Have a look at this proof : Consider this ball moving in a gravity free space :  What do you expect it’s position to be after the bounce ?  In this case one could easily predict the ball’s position knowing the perfect geometry of the ball and the walls . Easy , huh ? Let’s make it harder : Consider this falling bottle about to break against the ground :  Knowing the physical quantities you can even picture the next moment :  Still easy huh ? Alright , let’s make this harder : Well , measuring his steps and other physical quantities , you can predict what might happen next .  Not sure huh ? Finally , have a look at this :  Yea , This is the Happening of the Big bang . The two galaxies about to collide About 8,000,000,000 years after the big bang , the very next moment was certain. If we were somehow able to compute the above situations accurately , we would successfully reach the formation of earth 8.8 billion years after the big bang . Computing further , reaching the present , the current moment could’ve been predicted at the time of the Big Bang . Thinking deeper , the rivers flowing , the wind blowing , EACH AND EVERY THING was supposed to happen . Even the neurons functioning in our brain right now which made you post this question on Quora were predicted to do so 13 Billion years ago . It’s just that it’s too hard for us to compute these unlike the above situations . What does that mean ? The present and the future were already written since the beginning of time . Precisely , the future was already destined . So my dear friend , every single thought you’re processing right now , every breath you take , every dawn . That’s how our destiny has already been written . Thanks for reading .

Please allow me to ask you a few questions  On 26th December 2004, An Indian Ocean earthquake measuring 9.1 to 9.3 on the richter scale ended up killing 230,000 to 280,00 people in 14 countries. And it was considered the deadliest natural disaster in recorded history. Was the death of all the people who died - predestined that they would die? or was it destiny that they were supposed to die? And the people who lived - did they control their own destiny which is why they didn’t die? Or was it destined they shouldn’t die? What do you think? Did god will this? Was it his masterplan? Did he do it so that the people whose families got destroyed - he would test them to see if the families that suffered - that they would still love him and worship him? Was this an act of anger because people were bad and evil? So by killing all the people nearly the coastline - god made a point? Or was it that only the people at the coastline were evil. But the people staying far away from the coastline were good people. So that is why he sent a Tsunami?  Adolf Hitler rose to power as the Chancellor of Germany and then as the dictator initiated the World War II with the invasion of Poland in 1939. He was responsible for killing 5.5 million jews, 19.3 million civilians and under his rule 29 million soldiers died due to the military action. So in this example - was it destined that Hitler should do this? Did he control his destiny and he choose to become evil or was destiny preplanned for him to be evil - so that even if he wanted to be good - he would still be bad. Did the people who die control their destiny or were they pre-destined to die? Was it gods will that this should happen? Where was god when Hitler was killing all these people? Or was it that God decided he should intervene at the right time - and the right time was after Hitler killed all the millions of people that now was the right time? If god knows everything, which means he knew Hitler would rise to power and he knew Hitler would kill the same children whom god brought into the world. So did he allow this so that there would be a special plan and purpose fulfilled? If was a solider or a jew could I have possibly chosen my own destiny? Or changed my own destiny? But then if it is all destiny then - Hitler should be blamed now - should he? Because no matte what he would do - destiny wouldn’t allow him to be good. So in other words - Hitler was ‘destined’ to be bad anyways. So doesn’t that make him good?  And finally, this is me getting my face tattooed. Is this destined that I was going to get my face tattooed? Or did I choose my destiny to get my own face tattooed? Or did god have a special plan for me to get my face tattooed? or was it like god didn’t plan this but I planned it for myself - which means god doesn’t plan everything - we do, but he stands back and watches to see whats going on. Then the question goes - if he allows you to do whatever you want - then what about the innocent woman who prays to god to protect her every single day - but a man rapes her - did god allow that? Or did he stand back and watch and decide - now is not the right time to interfere in this matter? Maybe after they all die - only then I will reward her and punish him. So until that for the next 50 years let her live with that mental and emotional scar? So what is it - destiny? predestined?  Now we can go on and on and on with examples, hypothesis and assumptions. And the fact of the matter is each side, group or individual will not agree without putting up a fight and trying to convince the other to their point of view. However, all I can do is give you my perspective. You see, we as human beings - we like to think. Rather, let me rephrase that statement - we as human beings love to think. If we are not thinking good things, we would be thinking bad things. If we are not thinking bad things, we could be thinking funny things. And if not that it would be either religious, sexual, kinky, evil, humorous, educational, naughty - I mean the list can go on and on and on. And at no point - we are not thinking. In fact even when we are sleeping - our mind is ‘thinking’ how to ensure the body works without problems. So as human beings we are meant to think. And given this problem - we also like to ‘think’ and ‘reason’ and give ‘meaning’ to things we cannot understand. And sometimes when we are jobless, we like to think and ask questions for which no one knows the meaning to - but they simply ask - because they want to know the ‘why’ of things. And that is where religious apologists become the ‘experts in knowing everything’. For example: Questions: Why did this happen?Answer: God has a special plan for you OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind OR God is punishing you Question: Why did this BAD thing happen?Answer: God has a special plan for you OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind OR God is punishing you Questions: Why did this GOOD thing happen?Answer: Praise God! He listened to my prayers OR God rewards those who believe in him OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind Questions: Why did Loy Machedo become an Atheist? Answer: God has a special plan for you OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind OR God was testing you and you gave up on him OR You have such weak faith Questions: Why did Loy Machedo the Atheist lose all his money? Answer: God is punishing you OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind OR God is giving you a message OR you got what you deserved Questions: Why did Loy Machedo the Atheist earn over $1,000,000? Answer: God has a special plan for you OR It was destined OR you attracted this with the power of your mind OR God wants you to do good OR this is Satan’s money The combinations are endless. But here is the thing. Can we prove any of the statements are correct? No. We can only assume. And whatever combination suits our agenda, our purpose and our thinking - we will accept only that - which is our Cognitive Bias So now the million dollar question is - what is true? what is false? what is the answer?  When I look at my life and see the various transformations I have gone through, I can tell you without a doubt, all those transformations were done by me. I choose to have that particular hairstyle, look or behavior. However, I couldn’t control the external factors that governed how I looked, behaved and acted. For instance, when I was young - I had to listen to whatever my parents told me (it was destined) but once I grew up, I took charge of my life (I created my own destiny) and then when I failed (it was destined) but finally I succeeded in becoming a global brand (I created my own destiny). If you notice what I did was, I took credit for my successes and the failures I blamed it on my destiny. And I could very well twist the argument the other way around and it would still sound correct to me. So now what is the answer to the Question to Destined? or Create Our Own Destiny? The answer is this: Whatever you say - WHATEVER - that answer is right for you and for you only. We human being like to believe we came into this world to achieve a purpose, to do something special, to make a difference, to achieve our purpose and to blah blah blah blah blah. And then one accident and you are dead. So then what happened to your purpose? what happened to ‘make a difference’? what happened to ‘do something special?’ - Keep this much in mind - as long as you are alive - you can keep going on and on and on about this ‘I am in control of my destiny, I am the Master of my Fate, I am the Captain of my Ship’. All sounds nice - until of course the name of your ship is ‘The Titanic’. So instead of going around searching and asking and discussing with others - I give people this solution. And the solution is this - so pay attention carefully. I tell them - “You decide whatever you feel is correct. Karma OR Destiny OR God OR No God OR Pre-destined OR Post Destined OR I am in control OR I can attract (chose the thing or person) to myself - whatever you decide - Guess what - YOU ARE RIGHT!” And I leave it to that. They smile happily and then they leave. Because if I were to tell them the truth that is “There is no purpose of your life.” OR “There is no god” OR “After you die - its finished” they will not like it - and I know this through personal experience of having debated with many top debaters and religious apologists and superstitious folks.  SO THE MOMENT OF TRUTHAs a young man who went through the journey to discover himself - I was head strong about my beliefs, just as people were headstrong about theirs. And what I realized after years and years and years of spending hours and hours and hours of debates, discussion and talks - is like finding the answer to the ‘Is the Glass Half Empty or Half Full’ Argument. No one is right and no one is wrong because no one wants to be wrong. And so how can you prove something - that cannot be proved? So just as I ‘cannot prove’ that Unicorns do not exist or there are No Tooth Fairies (You cannot prove of something that is not there - try it) - I cannot prove if it is ‘created’ Destiny or Pre-Destined. If it is Created - then what about the victims who dies? Did they create this reality? And if it is pre-destined, then people like Hitler should be regarded innocent because no matter what - even if he wanted to be good - Destiny wouldn’t allow it to go that way - because it was ‘pre-destined’. So you now have a choice. Either you can do what I do - Just say ‘Whatever you say is right. Because if you argue with Logic - they will fight, argue, shout, give me some verse with some numbers like “Austin 3:16 says” OR “Ray 6:19 says” OR “The 7th verse from the 6th Chapter of the 14th Book of the 1,437th Printed Version says that god spoke to his people and……” OR at in the most comedic reference Ponda Byrne in her book ‘The Cigarette’, Eeek Hart Stool in his best selling book “The Shower of Now” and Debug Soap Opera in his best selling book “Creating A-fool-Essence” says “Destiny is the vibrations that goes through the Climatic Discontinuity of the Supernova Fusion from the Ions of the Non-Essential & Non-local 11th dimension filled in the womb of the 4th Multiverse through the alignment of the 7 Chakras in the Quantum Soup that revolves in Space Time Events through the Infinite Intelligence in the lap of the Sea of Consciousness” So do you want to take charge of your destiny and end the argument or lets destiny decide when the argument should end? Well, it doesn’t matter anyways. Because whatever you choose as your destiny, was always destined. Loy Machedo 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami - Wikipedia Adolf Hitler - Wikipedia List of cognitive biases - Wikipedia woo or woo-woo - The Skeptic's Dictionary - Skepdic.com

Dear Friend,  There is surely destiny. There is no doubt about it. You are born in a particular home, you are born as a human being, the color of your eyes, the situations of your birth, everything that goes around you in the universe, all that is destiny. There is no doubt about it. So there is a lot that is just happening, and is outside the domain of your free-will. Simply call it ‘destiny’. Sharing an excerpt for you from my blog 'Words Into Silence' on 'What is destiny?' This will help you. :)   Destiny is something  that you never wished for, desired for, and is yet happening. And of that, the first event is your birth. Does anybody desire his or her own birth? Did you desire your birth? You did not, right? Do you desire that at a particular time a bus must pass on the highway, and also honk? We don’t desire all these things. Right. All this is destiny, and there is no doubt about it. And destiny is important. There can be an earthquake any time. An asteroid may hit the earth, and we all would be vaporised. Right? All this is destiny. You must be knowing how the dinosaurs got eliminated. How did they vanish? There was a huge cloud over the earth, a cloud of dust, and there was no sunlight on earth for a very long period of time. Because of this the entire atmosphere of earth changed, and the dinosaurs perished. So that is destiny. Did any dinosaur write an application that the temperature should change, the flora and fauna should change, and ultimately we should vanish? It just happened. A lot of things that we carry inside this body, is destiny. We all know that people are genetically predisposed to diseases. Are they not? Who knows that many one of you sitting here may actually be carrying the seeds of a dangerous disease. All that is destiny. You never wanted it, but you get it. But far more important than destiny is something else.  We are not denying the force of destiny. All that we are saying is, that in spite of being important, it is nothing compared to another force. And that is the force of intelligence. That is the force understanding. And destiny is nothing compared to that force. All that destiny means is, external situations. And that external includes the body, because the body too is external to you. You are your center, your body is an external entity. So whatever happens here or there, it’s all just incidental. Accidental, and hence destiny. At the center resides the great power of intelligence, and that power is far bigger than the power of destiny. Destiny can only make outer events happen, but destiny can never touch your core. Never. So destiny is powerless when it comes to the real you, the core. There, destiny is absolutely powerless. Destiny cannot touch your core.The body can be hurt, wounded, destroyed, but your response to that event that cannot be dictated by the external force that is hurting, or wounding, or destroying. You have no control over what the world does to you, over the various forces in the universe, but you have all the control over yourself. And the one who controls himself, effectively controls the universe. Destiny has no value then. The one who has found himself, the one who has moved to the center, destiny is powerless in front of him. The one who has not found himself would forever remain a slave of destiny. So whether or not destiny is important, depends on you. If one who has not found yourself, the one who does not live at the core, then he would always be a slave of destiny. There would only be destiny in his life. “Why do I have a lot of money? Because I was born in a rich family.  Why do I keep chasing women all the time? Because I was born with male chromosomes.  Why am I pursuing such and such job? Because I did B.Tech.  Why did I choose B.Tech.? Because I had subjects Physics, Chemistry, and Maths in class Twelfth?  Why did I have these subjects in class Twelfth? Because it was fashionable to choose these subjects, when I was doing class Tenth?  Why were you doing your class tenth from such a place where there was this fashion? Because I was born in a particular state, of a particular country, in particular economic conditions. So the situations of your birth are dictating your entire life. That is slavery. Your place of birth is dictating your entire course of education. Your education is dictating your job. Your job is dictating your wife. Your wife is dictating your family. And there is hardly anything more to your life. There is nothing more to your life. So the entire life is being dictated by the situations of birth. The very fact that you were born in a particular year, in a particular family, with a particular gender decides the entire course of your life. That’s it. Do you want to live like that? “Because I was born in the year 1993, in the Gupta family, as a girl, therefore I am a homemaker today with five kids. That is the story of my life.” How many of you would want to be like that? “Because I was born in the year 1990 as a Hindu, or as a Muslim, so I have devoted my entire life to the service of my cult.” Don’t you see that all these incidents are just random occurrences? Were you greatly interested at the time of your birth, that whether you should be born a Muslim or a Hindu? The moment you were born, did you run towards a mosque or a temple? Imagine the child is newly born, and he is running to the church. And the doctors and the nurses are chasing him. The child is saying, “I am a devotee. After coming to the world, the first thing that I must do is to say ‘Thank you’ to the lord.” Did that happen? But today you act as if your religious identity is your biggest asset. Is that so? That is the price you pay, that is the punishment you suffer, for not being at your center. The one who will not live by his intelligence, will have to live by his destiny. In fact, the lack of intelligence will become his destiny. When I say ‘intelligence’, I do not mean cleverness. Intelligence is that which shines in attention. Intelligence is that which shines when the ego has made way. Intelligence is that which starts shining when the mind says, “I want to know.” So it is all in your control. The moment you say, “I really want to know,” the power of intelligence becomes available to you. That is called attention. The feeling that – “I really want to know,” this is attentiveness. That power is always available to you. Whatever is your situation, you can always instantaneously move into attention. Everything else, all other powers, can be taken away from you. But the power to understand can never be taken away from you. Whatever be the condition, even in your worst of conditions, you can still understand what is going on. So intelligence is always available to you. You can never lose it. Those of you who do not want to live pre-scripted life, predestined life, must learn to be bold. They must learn to move beyond their patterns. They must not be afraid of something new happening. Otherwise you will find that there is a script ready for you, and all that you are doing is going by that script. Isn’t the script already ready for you? Tell me. Is a script not ready for you? How does it feel to live a life as if the chapters of the script are opening, and you are just acting as per the script? It has been pre-decided. It was already certain what you will do class Tenth, class Twelfth, then a B. Tech., then maybe M.B.A., M.S. or job. And then marriage, then kids, then a house, then some money in your bank account, then certain responsibilities of your parents and kids, and then death. Finished. How many of you want to live like this, where everything is already decided? This way even your life-span is kind of decided. Marriage between the age of twenty-five to thirty, kids at thirty, thirty-five. Even the number of kids is also already decided. Thirty years back it would be three, four or five. Now may be one or two. So everything is destined. Just the time of your birth, the place of your birth is deciding everything. So if your birth-place is China, you cannot have kids more than one. Do you know that in India, in a disproportionately large number of families, the youngest kid is a boy. Because the families keep aborting the girl child, till they get a boy. So usually you will find that the youngest kid in the family is a boy. And the boy is born after the three-four girl child have been aborted. so, it is pre-decided. The last kid is the boy. Now what will happen to this boy who has come after so much slaughter? Do you want to live like that? You want to live with this destiny? Do you see how powerless all this is? Do you see that this is sheer slavery? Or can there be freedom beyond destiny? Can there be life beyond destiny? You have to ask that to yourself. If today somebody  comes to you and hands over the script to your life to you ans says, “Live it,” how will you feel? Every single breath that you take has been pre-decided. Is that already not the case? So it’s a good question to ask, “Is there a life beyond destiny?” There is, but it is only for the strong, the courageous and the surrendered. Because that is the only source of strength and courage. Surrender! One becomes really afraid: “O my god! Going beyond your destiny. Why take so much pain when a script is already ready? why should I write a new script? Somebody has done so much of effort. He has already written a complete script. Why should I violate that? Pay some respect to the script.”Just like a puppet pays respect. Have you seen a puppet? Everything is already ready for the puppet. Puppet pays great respect to its script. It does nothing that is not written in the script. Beautiful life of a puppet. Right? You want to live like that? Now the puppet will enter a B. Tech. program because everybody else is doing that. The puppet will work hard to get more than seventy-five percent marks. (Mockingly)  “Son now you have started earning. It is time to get married. “And you feel so puffed-up. The next chapter of the script is unfolding.“What can I do? The situations were such that I had to do this.” You sing songs also where you attribute everything to destiny. “ Waqt ne kiya kya haseen sitam. Tum rahe na tum, hum rahe na hum (If destiny would have allowed, you would have been mine. Destiny was so cruel. I did not remain myself, you did not remain yourself).” So everything is destiny.Why  are you  alive? “Destiny Sir. When death will come, I will die. When I had no role to play in my birth, why should I have any role to play in my death? Everything is destiny. Kahaani Kismet Ki (The story of destiny)” It eases our burden. Right? We know that we are stupid. But we won’t say that. What we will say? “Kismet kharaab hai (Bad Luck)” Why not simply say, “I am stupid”? Why blame things on destiny? Destiny is there, obviously there for everybody. The question is that what are you doing to yourself. Nobody has control over destiny. But what is your response to the destiny.An intelligent man lives in attention, not under the influence of destiny. And the moment he starts living in attention, destiny looses its control on him. now destiny cannot dictate its influence on him.   AJ

Growing up, my mother always told me, “whatever happens, happens for the best”. Growing up i realised that a lot of people suffer a lot and just die suffering without seeing the “good” part, i added, “whatever happens, is for good if you are good!” Growing more up, i realised that most of the people suffering are actually good, from a four year boy being bombed in syria, to a 11 day old girl being raped in another country (yeah 11 days!!) I realised that both my mother’s and my philosophy were wrong!! However the answer was however simple! Look at a pen on your table, try to move it without touching it. Will it? Obviously no right! It is probably human behavior that we can look at things clearly if they are small and immediate. But if some one else, unknown, comes and moves that pen, will you call it a destiny? Our life is basically a collection of decisions taken by us OR by some one else (some human or animal too, incase a lion decides to eat you) just like moving the pen. So basically if you decide to do something like studying for an exam, you will have the result because you moved the pen. And if america decides to bomb you, you will get bombed because america decides to move the pen (no hate for america, just an example). So whatever happens is just a result of some human or animal taking that decision. So instead of waiting for some invisible force (called destiny) to move your pen, move it yourself. And if some one else is trying to throw your pen, try your best to stop that :) Good “luck” :)

One of the greatest and everlasting debates of humanity has been about the role of destiny in the lives of human beings. There was a time when it was almost an accepted fact of life that each and every event was governed by destiny of human beings. Astrology was considered a science. Then with the advent of modern times the importance of role of destiny as a concept started losing weight. Today, belief in destiny is considered a superstition by majority of people. And rightly so, since there seems to be no evidence for the irrevocability of destiny. There are three schools of thoughts about fate. The most prevalent these days seems to be the one which says that there is nothing called destiny or fate. This line of thinking says that human beings do possess free will. All our successes, failures and actions are governed by the decisions we take. If we take correct decisions and act accordingly, no one can prevent us from achieving what we want to. If we fail, it must be due to something wrong on our part. We have the option to take decisions using our free will. In this line of thinking, fate is considered a superstition at worst and at best one can regard it as a psychological defense system to cope with the failures in life. Whenever you fail in some endeavor or whenever something happens which is not in accordance of your wish, you use it as a convenient scapegoat. You say, it was your bad luck which caused you to fail. Otherwise, how could you fail? You are never ready to accept that it was you who was responsible for the failure. It may have been due to some bad planning, lack of efforts in the right direction or outright failure to correctly judge the realities of your goal. But since it hurts to accept that you were the one who committed the mistake, you take shelter behind the concept of fate and blame it on your karma. This relieves you of the terrible pain of knowing and accepting the defeat. This line of thinking has gained currency mainly because of the persons who subscribe to this theory. Among the votaries of this theory, one will hardly ever find people who can be called a failure in their lives. Almost all of the people who are considered as successful in their lives agree with this line of thinking. They say there is nothing called fate, they believe in themselves and in the existence of free will. Other people, looking at the supporters of this theory, grudgingly start accepting it since the logic, that one must be right if he is successful, comes into play.  This theory leaves many a questions of life unanswered. For example, this theory does not even begin to answer the question of differences between different people at the point of their birth. Why one is born to rich parents and another to poor ones? Why are some children born healthy and some sick or crippled in some way? There are many such questions, but for starters such questions suffice. Apart from offering the word "Coincidence", it has no credible sounding answers. There can be many arguments for and against this theory, but the debate is bound to remain inconclusive. It must be said at this point that once a successful person, who does not believe in destiny, starts experiencing failures, he slowly begins to accept the existence of fate. Perhaps, the experiences of people are the strongest arguments in favor of destiny.  There is another school of thought which seems to be the most logical line of thinking. It says you are free to take the first step, but as soon as you take it, your second step becomes inevitable and predictable. You become bound by the different laws of life which govern the outcome of an act. Let us take an example. Say, you are going to plant a tree. As long as you have not done it, you have plenty of options. You may choose not to plant the seed at all. You may choose the type of tree you wish to grow. But once you have taken that decision and acted upon it, your freedom is curtailed by many degrees. If you plant a mango tree, then no matter what you do you cannot get any other fruit from that tree. Of course, even for reaping the harvest of mangoes you have to keep you fingers crossed. You cannot guarantee that the seed you just planted will grow to a big tree at all. It may also happen that the tree grows, bears fruit, but you cannot taste even a single fruit. There might be plenty of reasons for this. In other words, your freedom is limited to the actions you take but not to the outcome of that act. This sounds logical because the outcome of any act depends on so many factors that one cannot realistically hope to have control over all those factors. That is why even the best laid plans of the mightiest and most intelligent people turn to dust. This concept is called "Law of Karma".  In the eastern philosophies, like Hindu or Buddhist philosophy, there is the concept of reincarnation. It says, we all keep taking birth after birth. This cycle of birth and death has been continuing since eternity, and will keep on repeating itself till a human being attains "Enlightenment". This state of enlightenment has been described differently by different sages. Some have called it Self-Realization, some have called it Self-Actualization. It is also known as attaining Moksha, Nirvana or Kaivalya. Only after one achieves it, one can break out of this relentless cycle of birth and death.  The law of Karma says that all that happens in one's life is result of his own deeds. One can never escape the fruits of whatever he has done. Just like different plants take different time spans to grow up, different actions also take different time spans to bear fruit. It may be that the result of some act may take more time to fructify than the remaining life span of the person who committed that act. In such cases, the person has to bear the results of such actions in his next life.  Now we come to the theory which says that all events are predestined. There is nothing called free will. We are all like instruments in some grand design and nothing else. All our thoughts and actions are predestined. I would give two arguments in favor of this theory. Let us first examine the subject of Astrology. It has also been a subject of a great and inconclusive debate. Is there some truth in the astrological sciences( see Astrology: A Science or Superstition)? I think that while it is not possible to establish the efficacy of Astrology beyond any doubt, it is perhaps more difficult to deny it altogether. Most of us have had some experience with astrologers where some of their predictions came out to be astonishingly accurate. It can be argued that a majority of astrological predictions fail. But I am not talking of failed predictions. There can be many reasons for that. I am focusing on the predictions which turn out to be true. How can it be possible for someone to predict some event of future? Let us consider for a moment a journey from one place to another. Someone who knows the route can tell us that city A will come after city B. Now it is only possible if the landscape remains unchangeable. If someone can change the location of cities then it would be impossible to predict this order. Similarly, the very fact that it is at all possible to predict future events, proves that future is unchangeable. And if it is so, then where is the place for free will? The second argument derives itself from the knowledge of modern science. It says that the whole universe is a continuum. What this means is that there is no part of the universe which is isolated from other parts. Whatever happens in one part of the universe influences the whole of it. This effect might not be detectable, but that it occurs cannot be denied. For example, if I throw a pebble in the Pacific Ocean then the disturbance it will create is bound to travel  to the other end of the ocean and affect the water molecules there. It is entirely another matter whether we are capable of measuring that effect or not. Similarly, take the case of stars billions of light years away from us. Since the light from those stars eventually reaches us, it must be influencing us in some way or the other. We also understand that for any event to take place there must be numerous events in the past which make this event possible. Each event is a culmination of innumerable events in the past as well as forerunner of some other event in the future. For example, for me to have taken birth the births of my parents was a necessary precondition and so on. If we start tracing back the turn of events which made my birth possible, we will have to go back to the very beginning of the universe. Now let us consider the insignificance of a human being in the scheme of the universe. Even a drop of water in the largest ocean has more significant presence in the backdrop of that ocean than a human being has in the universe. What this signifies is that it is impossible for a man to change the course of events, since the causes of those events lie not in his domain but in the whole of the past of the universe. Can one realistically hope to negate the whole tide of the past considering the limits of his much less than insignificant strength, thought or will? PS:The text above is not written by me but it is one of the best articles I have read on this topic.

Nope. Destiny doesn’t exist. So. God made sperm# 1,985,234 come into contact with my Mom’s egg. I was born I was hyperactive, bad grades, disruptive. We moved, I was put on ADD meds. I was grumpy and introverted. I was diagnosed with Epilepsy. I graduated High School and was ripped off my meds. I was asked, politely, to leave Collin County Community College(I majored in Student Union). I worked part time for six years, worked for EDS for four years. Was laid off during a restructuring. Bounced from temp job to temp job(mostly due to my ADHD). My brother committed suicide. My parents divorced three years later(I became Mom’s emotional support). I found the love of my life, and we got married. My wife had two miscarriages. I had to take my father off of life support. I went into an addictive cycle that bankrupted my family and separated me from my wife and toddler daughter. I am now married 10 years. Have a five year old daughter, and I am in my fourth year of sobriety. If a God wanted this to be my path, I want absolutely NOTHING to do with him, the savage bastard. And, if this is part of some Grand Plan, I refuse to acknowledge it.

It’s complicated? Freewill e have power and the free will to do what we do. Our action , what we choose to do and what we choose to work towards becoming That is our free will. Destiny However, we don’t really have contorl over the consequence of our actions. What happens after we do something isn’t up to us. Sure there are many times where the result was exactly what we thougt our action would cause. But i’m sure that we have all don’e something with the results being completely unexpected. If what happens as a result of our actions can be random and even opposite of what it was supose to be, then it could be that it is by the same chance when things happen like they were suppose to. Basicaly we can do what we want, but no matter what we do will never know for sure what will happen until it happens. Since we have no control over all that has happened. Then everythingl that had happened, happened simply beause they were suppose to happen. And everything that is going tohappen will happen, because they were suppose to happen. FREEWILL We are who we are because of what we have experinced in life. So even though we have no control over what haplepens. We can control how we percieve it and choose to learn from it. Any experience in which we learn and grow from is no less than a meaningful experience. As such, nothing ever happens happens without meaning. ..Action (freewill) -> Consequence of action (Destiny) -> Find meainng in consequence (freewill) ..

If you're asking for an absolute answer, I doubt any human has - or ever will have - the necessary degree of omniscience required to unequivocally answer such a question. Destiny has always played a pivotal role and has significantly influenced various cultures, creeds and empires throughout history. In greek mythology, destiny was decided by the Moirai; otherwise known as the 3 fates; Clotho who spun the thread of life, Lachesis who measured it to decide how much time was allocated for each and every mortal and Atropos who finally cut the twine with shears at the moment of a mortal's death. The influence destiny had over the society of Ancient Greece was such that even the Gods themselves couldn't escape its power or influence; a true testament as to how powerful a force it was considered to be. Humans have always divided their reservations over whether or not their actions truly have any impact on the direction life progresses. Some resign themselves to the notion that events in life transpire in the manner that they were always meant to; while others argue that destiny cannot truly exist in a reality where an individual possesses free will and is, as such, at liberty to govern what, if anything, holds sway over their lives. To take a simple example to illustrate a point of view; wealth... Some families have enough income to financially secure the lives of entire generations without any cause for concern while others would be lucky to even secure their own. Are some people destined to be born into wealth and others into poverty? In the end an individual's existence is determined by the actions of their parents reproductive decisions.  Ultimately, who we are and what we make of our lives is nothing more or less than the sum total of all the events that make it up. We're defined by the choices; the good and the bad; that we make.

We don't know exactly how our universe was born but the most plausible and most agreed upon one among every other theory is Big Bang theory and so let's go with it. 13.7 billion years ago, an infinitesimal point into which the entire universe was compressed under infinite pressure burst out, throwing all the atoms and molecules​and energy outwards. It blast forth in such a spectacular force that these travelled to great long distances, distances we can only imagine, distances we cannot even count. Then as time went on, these random atoms and molecules condensed and started forming dense matters - stars, asteroids, planets, etc. As time went on and on, around 4.3 billion years ago, a chunk of material that detached itself from our sun settled at a particular point and started orbiting it. Then as foreign matters from asteroids came and settled in this mass of rock; random chemical reactions gave birth, quite by accident, to the first cells which discovered a means of reproduction and propagation. As time went on, process of natural selection - as we call it - set in and complex life forms came forth. Things became more and more complex, as time went on, and then at a particular point of time one of the various forms of life started to “think.” It gained self knowledge (consciousness). Then it invented rituals and random personifications to explain things unknown to it. This species, as time went on, dominated, through its wit, the entire planet so much. And new and new innovations, new questions, self doubt, self discovery, everything happened and right now, one member of that species asks in a format (language) that it created for itself, to its fellow members, through a communication medium (Quora) that it invented itself if destiny exists. I'm not really sure. Does it exist?

No. This is because whatever the destiny might be, we humans hold the power to defy it. Let’s say God told you that you are destined to create a new nation, or do good for the society after becoming a billionaire. But you have the choice to end all of that promise, simply by jumping off a bridge somewhere, or swerving left while driving onto incoming traffic; in other words, you have free will. In addition to active sabotage of your destiny, other can also destroy it, either intentionally, passively or even accidentally. Destiny does not make you bullet-proof, or cancer-proof, or mistake-proof, so there are so many ways in which destiny goes unfulfilled, by early death or otherwise, and an unfulfilled destiny, is not destiny. And the existence of unfulfilled destiny defies the concept of destiny, similar to, if you were able to find an instance where God is helpless, then whoever that is, is not God (definitional problem). The correct concept is potential. Potential is having sufficient talent, skill, energy, etc. but all other things must work out well also, for the potential to reach its fulfillment. Destiny appears to exist, only because we are connecting the dots backwards. Destiny cannot be forward looking, unless you are talking about certitudes of life, like “you are destined to die one day”, or that piece of carcass is “destined to rot”, but that’s usually not the way the term ‘destiny’ is used.

No, my friend. Rather, I would say destiny is an accident for most people, art for some and a never-ending search for the rest.. Newton's destiny was an accident. The way the world saw him changed drastically only because of the fall of an apple.!! Most inventions today, are products of accidents. N-number of people landed in our history books by accident.. Yet, we can learn that some people have done in the past, and some in the present seamlessly crafting their own murals in the halls of fame, through managed thought, focused attention and deliberate action.. But those who are hopelessly pointing fingers on others, blaming their time and stars, are searching forever.. to find out what gets them where.. and the funniest part, they proclaim themselves as believers and followers of the first category people, stated above.. so waiting for such accidental miracles to happen on themself.. Poor souls, they didn't know even the grace required for accidental success comes only with faith and efforts.. Destiny is not existential.. but it is the evidence you leave behind after walking the journey of life ..

People confuse destiny with something like predefined future. If future is fixed there is no free will. If there is no free will humanity doest not exist. Then humans are nothing but an automaton - a very complex machine but predictable. Infact that means entire cosmos is one giant predictable machine. Here is one catch to predictability. If everything is predictable or pre destined then sooner or later humans through science will decode the underlying laws. In that case predictability will cause humans to alter the outcome which makes the entire thing unpredictable. As you can see exercise of free will alters predictability of the part of universe which they belong to. Presence of free will causes future to be completely uncertain and certainly unknowable. One more aspect to it is that humans have two parts - machine or non machine. Non machine part has awareness and therefore free will. If people are not aware then machine part takes over. In that case they are nothing more than an automaton. Majority of humans are living in this state. They dont make choices òut of free will but compulsions. Destiny is direction not destination of one's journey. No matter what direction one takes it takes one towards the mystery. A painter will reach the infinite with his paintings, a musician with his instrument.and so on. To discover your destiny is to discover the infinite within you. That way destiny is only one. Only conscious people have destiny and rest dont have. If one says God determines future then I say only God can save you ;). End of discussion.

We can define destiny at the abstract level. But, if we talk about destiny as an absolute thing,  it's difficult to  define and most likely it's a by product of consequences. Let's start with some real life scenarios.  Will our future generations go to school? It doesn't matter if the answer is yes or no. What matters is the future direction of human society. So, going to a school  is not a destiny but a planned outcome of our civilized society. This is a case of unnatural (human made) consequence.  Giving birth to a child is also not a destiny. We can predict the outcome of our results. Sometimes prediction can go wrong. This is a case of natural consequence. Can humanity survive for another million years? Again it depends on how fast we damage our environment or if our DNA is capable to survive another million years. So far, the earth is only known planet where humans can survive naturally. If we change the natural ecosystem too much, we can't survive long enough. This is one more example of consequence.In brief, our language system has been developed to a great extent in last few thousand years and we have a long list of nice words in our dictionaries. I find destiny is one of these nice words though used extensively. I follow my own quote frequently when I hear the word destiny,  "Some people create their own destiny while others believe in the word destiny" Anil Kumar

Consider a flower.  It began as a seed nestled in the soil growing in two directions, one pressing deeper into the ground while the other pushes upwards.  Leaves slowly unfold and the stem thickens reaching for the sun.  A bud appears and bursts into a bloom that draws bees carrying pollen borrowed from an anther to its stigma to produce the next generation’s seed. Is it destiny that brought the blossom?  Was the combination of genes, the specific bee and the flower it visited before bringing the fertilizing powder predetermined?  If our flower could look back over the history of its existence, it might seem that it was destined to be.  However, a sentient seed seems unlikely to envision what would come from its existence.   It could not know if the soil would support life or a bird consume it before it began to grow or too little or too much rain would fall, or someone’s foot crush the life from it.  Which of these fates would be destined to befall it?  It seems to me that life holds too many variables for destiny to be real.

Google defines destiny as, ”The events that will necessarily happen to a particular person or thing in the future.” Only if we had a time machine which would have taken us to time t+1, let us witness that time and then would have returned us back to time t, we would not have believed in destiny at time t+1 since we already knew at time t what is going to happen at time t+1 (applauds for the time machine) and we would have bwen able to change our futures. But till the point in time when we invent a time machine or determine some way to see our futures, we cannot witness our futures and anything- whether good or bad- inflicted upon us has to be ascribed to a multitude of factors (over almost all of which we have no control at all) and the one word substitution for these factors is destiny. It is a question of faith and religious views whether you believe in destiny or not, but we have to term something which we cannot explain and destiny is one such term. What I cannot create, I do not understand. - Richard Feynman

When one talks about destiny, then one means that his fate is already sealed from the start. It would be necessary to reach that point and that is beyond any control. Then, no, destiny is not real. Nothing meets something else because it is meant to be by some transcendent relation that tie both beings in an unbreakable tie. Because man is free, therefore fate cannot affect him. He is free to choose whatever he wants. It could be an illusion of freedom, but we should not confuse determinism with fatalism. Determinism is when something is bound to happen in the exact same circumstances, like a pencil free-falling when released. Fatalism is a metaphysical rope that ties someone to his unavoidable end. Also, destiny is not compatible with morality. If man is bound to reach towards his destiny and has absolutely no control over it, then no one would have any reason to condemn him for his bad actions.

I don't hesitate to say - “Destiny doesn't exist.” We, human beings, always expect something good to come back to do something good We tie-up things to situations. We always try to escape to see the true face of reality. We create an imaginary character called “Karma” and we call it a female dog - which does not make any sense at all Realise! It is hard to accept that a person who once ditched you will never feel broken like how you felt exactly that moment on that day. Realise! Those blessings of that hunger man whom you served with a delicious food on that Christmas night would never come to you because “destiny does not have a way of finding you.” So, how are we living if nothing is coming back to us neither love nor hatred? It is the TIME. We forget people, hatred, love, truth, knowledge, your pet, that nice coffee, your ex and everything on this earth, in the space with “TIME.” Believe in you. Not the circumstances☀

For my own convenience, I believe that all abstract concepts were developed by humans, for their convenience. The fatalistic schools of thought came up with this one: destiny. Science would obviously dismiss it as being unscientific. But imagine a situation in our historic past when the king would behead anyone who brought bad news. In that situation, DESTINY could very well have proved to be a very useful concept. I also believe, on a much more serious note, that every abstract concept - whether it was posited by Einstein or was simply one of our superstitions - has a very definite point of origin. It is therefore there only because there are people who have believed in it, even found it 'useful' So, instead of merely dismissing such concepts as being true or untrue, I prefer to view them from the perspective of a social psychologist who is empathetic toward all creations of the human mind.  Finally, I also believe in giving every thing the importance that is due. No more, no less. If for one person in the world there's such a thing as destiny, others have no business dismissing it - even if it is un- or non-scientific.

Destiny does’t exist, because: the idea of destiny is - destiny is a force that makes sure that particular event takes place despite the odds. But we came to realization since Lorenz weather modeling, that there is such thing as system that accumulates changes over time and it is inherently unpredictable. One of such systems is weather, another is sperm-cells reaching for the egg. If a different sperm cell arrives this will result in a different person being born, there are millions of sperm cells starting the race at unequal conditions, someone ahead, someone behind. If your father decides to bang your mom for 1 second longer. your existence will be prevented and someone else will be born. Destiny can’t exist under such conditions, causality in this reality is too sensitive to smallest changes and accumulates changes over time at insane phase. Now, have fun dealing with an existential crisis.

Destiny is merely a myth, designed to bring meaning, purpose, and acceptance to people's lives. It gives a level of comfort to people who need answers to questions about their choices; questions which are usually impossible to answer.Destiny is most often associated with love. It elevates a person's choices in love to an origin of a higher and irresistible power. This removes anxiety, questions, and doubts about their choices.Its easy to be comfortable with your choices if you believe you never had the power to make them in the first place.Destiny is a myth. Free will is a reality.

As it is raining today, and I cannot work in my garden, I’ll “answer” this, Yes, destiny is real. No, destiny is not real. Real: This morning I went to court at the request of a friend to sit and watch - giving moral support - in a small claims case he had filed. As I sat in the outer lobby, a person that I had filed a small claims case against came and signed in. As I had not gotten any notice that my case was due that day, I inquired of my friend why this obnoxious person was there. Friend suggested that it was to answer me. I checked and found that the case. If I had not come along, my case would have been dismissed. Not real: The earth did not open up under this obnoxious person and swallow him to the nether regions.

When we meet new people, we get the feeling we have known them all our life, why? Life path as I see it is complex to explain, but I will keep it simple. Everything has happened and we live a dream, this dream is what we have already done. Everything has happened and we are just going through the motions. By trying to change the way we are is futile, it has already happened. If we are wealthy or poor, sick or healthy, it has already happened. The best we can do is be grateful for what we have and who we are and enjoy the ride. To give an illustration: when we watch a long tube on the PC, it has increments of lines, these are commercials. Life is the same thing, when we meet  someone or got sick or whatever, we are just hitting these destined lines that cannot be changed. Then the answer to a good life is simple, enjoy the ride and be grateful for what we have. The end has happened?

The idea that everyone’s future is pre-planned may concern simply the eventual destination, or the means by which that is achieved. The difference involves the possibility of so-called free will, or simply the uncertainty of life’s interactions.. The eldest son of a reigning monarch may well be considered as being destined to rule. If that does not happen, some would say that it was destined to be otherwise, and perhaps that is simply being wise after the event. The one thing of which you can be sure, is that you can’t be sure of anything. Chaos Theory?

"Dear Dad, my whole life, I've been told I was destined for greatness based solely on the virtue of my name. I was taught sacrifice was for the foolish. Survival was all that mattered. But now I find myself at a crossroads, and I must decide what I believe to be true. There is no such thing as destiny. Legacies must be earned by the choices we make. I now know that we write our own endings, and we can either choose to hide as villains or live as heroes."  Daniel Grayson ( Revenge) That quote sums up my life.  You need to write your own endings. We live in a box.We drive in a box.We work in a box.One day, we will all die in a box. Crush the box... And write your own ending...

Sometimes some things are written in your fate. No matter how hard you may try to change them, they never change. A short story. The Crow and the Parrot were both created ugly. The Parrot protested and was made beautiful. However the crow remained content with the will of its creator. Today, Parrot is in cage.  And, Crow flies free.  Image source: Google Images Behind each incident is so exquisite a wisdom that maybe you will never understand it. Therefore, never ask Why? To the creator! Note: Although I believe in destiny, doesn't mean I can ignore hard work for success.

Well to me at a macro-scopic level concept of destiny is true. That is the life cycle follows some kind of steps - be it mosquito, ant, humans or other living. But at a micro-scopic level the events that happen in life are RANDOM collisions. That is not destiny.  And Nature wants it seriously that way, I feel. Nature is all creative and random.  So the learning to me is - we can only generalize things to some extent always. That is not all Indians are stupid and Not all non-indians are smart.  Like wise at process level stages may be same, but every other person's life is not articulated earlier but it grows on only one factor called "probability" in the natural or intuitive direction. And direction itself may or may not qualify for accounting destiny.

Destiny plays a major role in our lives.If we are destined to do something,we will be able to achieve it..If we dont have the destiny to achieve that thing,then how much ever we try,we cannot get that.Why do you think people who are happily in relationships (I am talking of true relationship ,not time pass) suddenly get separated for no bound reasons.Dear ,its all because they were not destined to be together.Hardwork or trying is definately important,but they are catalyst or booster.If your equation is not valid at all ,then how hard you try for the solution ,using catalyst(that is hardwork and trying)it would not happen...

No destiny like your sense of self is just a 'post hoc' justification of historic events. For the concept of destiny to be true, then there must be a way of predicting events that is infallible. This would mean predictions mad in advance of the outcomes that actually occur after the predictions. To date, despite Nostradamus nuts and religious fanatics, this has not been achieved. Why destiny is like your sense of self is that latest thinking on personality would suggest that decisions are made subconsciously and the narrative and justification comes in your consciousness

The angels say we come to this life with “travel plans” - people we want to meet, circumstance we wish to experience, etc. However we have free will and in every moment of our lives our choices and perceptions create our life and point us toward a certain future. We are the ones who get to choose and change things. So we do not have a “Destiny” per se, more like desired experiences with the right to change our minds. Now, that said, there are some souls who come in deeply desiring a certain path and they are very unlikely to change. We often call that destiny.

Princess Mononoke (1997) is a Japanese animated fantasy film. In response to what fate had foretold him … a young Emishi prince, Ashitaka, journeys west to undo a fatal curse inflicted upon him by a boar/demon. The wise woman of the Emishi states, “You cannot alter your fate, my prince. However, you can rise to meet it if you choose. It’s your fate to go there and see what you can see with eyes unclouded by heat. You may find a way to lift the curse. Whatever comes to pass, you are dead to us forever.”

Yes and no. The more you raise your consciousness, the more choices you have. You always have some degree of free will but there are cosmic forces at work that influence your life and there are consequences to your actions. You can rise above these influences the more you raise your consciousness.

In absolute terms, probably.  The world and everything in it is in one way or form a mechanism so in that sense, everything is probably pre-determiend to happen. BUT in practical terms? No, because it is not predictable or otherwise knowable.  Chaos theory shows us that very simple mechanisms can produce unpredictable results.  And we are talking a very very very very very very complex mechanism when we talk about all of existence.

I think we create our own destinies. At a certain point, pathways in our life become so urgently felt, that we feel compelled to make our way across them at whatever the cost. Simultaneously, the world thrusts circumstances on us and we’re again compelled to work and shape our lives in such a way, where we can obtain happiness or some form of joy, and from this, we again forge a path. A friend of mine said life is robust and I believe this robustness is the ability we have as sentient human beings to forge paths from old pasts as we constantly iterate towards a “one” destiny.

Yes, there is a thing called destiny. Whether it will rain or not is already decided but you have the power to control how much you want the rain to affect you. You can either stand in the rain or stand in the shed. You have the power to decide how you let the things that happen around you affect you. Things are pre-destined but we have the power to control them.

No, it does not. It is simply a great concept to comfort ourselves when we don't find suitable explanations to things that happen to us. I think "destiny" came up a long time back, when men somehow forgot to understand the power of their free will.

My bro Loy Machedo has already said it in depth. I would not delve deeper. But what I’d like to say is: #1 Destiny doesn’t exit, but of course, you do.#2 If it does exist, it’s actually the path that you map.#3 And while you do exist, do what you can do the best, don’t go after the superlatives.#4 If you do that, then it doesn’t matter whether destiny exits, god exists, or you and me exist.

I've always struggled with the idea of destiny as pre-destination. That I'm not really able to alter the course of my life… shudder. And then I watched a silly little movie starring Goldie Hawn called Protocol. A character in the movie says something like “destiny delivers opportunities. It is your character that decides what you make of them.” And I thought “Yeah. I can live with that.” I've lived a life since that tries to reflect that.

Yeah!   He can decide what to eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner. He can order whatever available in a restaurant. He can buy imported products.  He can decide to be good or evil. He can restrain his desire. He can improve his image. He can make his behaviour better...  He can read my answer or ignore it.  But he was born to age and die in the end just everyone and everything.  One's responsible for own actions. The nature does according to its law.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Shekhar Chaudhary, Rhea Lee and 1 more

response.answer_text: Depends on your definition of reality. We will probably never know for sure if the universe is predetermined and everything that happens is just a chain of consequences which we don’t understand. But if you believe in destiny it becomes real to you. And that will have consequences.

I think yes , in the sense that much is predetermined such as the absolute need to breathe etc , there are many other aspects of life that are equally so determined .These things are the limits of our exsistance. Free will within the predestined limits.
Yes,It does... Everything happens,happens for a reason;and sometimes you can't control what happens...i think thats destiny
It is if you choose to believe it, it's a mental construct one can use to either limit or unleash oneself

Destiny is real… Even you are not in control..your mind is made up like that to think as you have free will. That is a trick of mind.All we think right now is predetermined by past events. Read my blog… Everything is explained. Theory of Destiny

Absolutely! I believe that people are prepackaged for success in a particular area of gifting. It is up to the individual to rediscover their gift and determine their true worth and value to the marketplace in the application of their gift and developed skills to solve problems for others. Check out: www.ceoofdestiny.com

Destiny certainly exists . . . that is the reason, at times, you find unexpected things - both good & bad happening in your life. Simply put, Destiny is the result of the past actions of your previous births. It is the consequence of the exercise of your free will, during your earlier lifetimes.
Destiny, yes, in a way that you think it is your choice. Nature controls your emotion and desire, basically governing everything you do to achieve its end.

Free will doesn't exist. Humans are organic robots, programmed by DNA, and the environment. Our conscious thoughts have absolutely no influence on the making of thoughts, decisions, or ideas. An MRI study on the decision making: The older part of the brain makes decisions seconds before the conscious mind. We share our brain with the decision making process.
I have answered just a similar question so i'll direct you there since you've me to answer-  Avani Dedhia's answer to Do you think destiny is real? Why or why not?

Things tend to work out in certain way. Because of the laws of nature, laws of society, common trends and traits. But there is no higher will above you dictating how you will live your life. Even most of common religions leave a place for free will.

Hard work to gain knowledge and information and to use it makes a person rich or great as for born physically handicapped children to find the reason behind it medical team experts are working hard to find reasons behind it so till now evidence for destiny is not found.
Absolutely, it even got a sequel Destiny the Game | Home
Destiny does exist. Certain events in life are unavoidable as they are destined to happen. Illness is one example.

Destiny and Free Will complement each other. Destiny gives Free Will something to rebel from, like denying its existence altogether. As for the benefit free will gives destiny, it would have to be the opportunity to let free will obey destiny and cooperate. This involves irony, defying human expectations, and Chaos Theory, the intertwinement of determinism and randomness which are crazy glued together by irony.
Chaos is destined to evolve truth.
